main event: The observer sighted a red and a white light attached to one object, which were about the size of the stars and were visible for approximately 6 minutes.
interesting points: No evidence was presented that the object was an aircraft.
The observer was asked to fill out a detailed questionnaire about the sighting, including questions about the time, location, weather conditions, and characteristics of the observed object.
The questionnaire includes instructions for the observer to draw sketches or diagrams to illustrate the object's motion, shape, and arrangement (if multiple objects were seen).
The observer was asked to provide information about whether anyone else witnessed the object and to describe their own background and experience.
The observer was asked to report when they first reported the sighting and to provide any additional relevant information not covered in the questionnaire.
sighted object: a red and a white light attached to one object, about the size of the stars
